painful.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if a part of your body is painful, it hurts
painful.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The neck becomes swollen and painful to the touch (=hurts when you touch it).
painful.translation[0].definitions[1].de: making you feel very upset, or very difficult and unpleasant for you
painful.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He and his wife took the painful decision to switch off their son’s life support machine.
the long and painful process of growing up
He sobbed as he recalled the painful memory.
Venice was a painful reminder of her marriage.
It can be painful to leave the house in which you were born.
The divorce was painful for both of us.
Even hearing his name was painful to her.
painful.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: a painful blow on the head
He was finding it painful to breathe.
painful.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if someone’s behaviour or a performance is painful, it is so bad that it embarrasses people
painful.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: It’s painful to watch her making the best of a terrible script.
painful.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 2: making you feel very upset, or very difficult and unpleasant for you
painful.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The photograph brought back painful memories.
It must have been a painful experience for you.
It was just part of the painful process of growing up.
The US is in for a painful period of adjustment.
I made the painful decision to move far away from my family.
The violence is a painful reminder that many issues have not yet been resolved.
We won’t be able to keep the painful truth from the children.
Patients are encouraged to talk about their painful feelings.
painful.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: when a part of your body hurts
used for describing a part of the body that hurts
Her leg is still painful where she broke it.
She was suffering from painful stomach cramps.
The skin around the wound is very tender.
Her body was stiff from sitting in the car for so long.
painful as a result of a wound, infection, or too much exercise
The wound was sore and red.
